results.title: Gruesome gray monster (Finding colours)
results.brief_description: Designed to sharpen perception and appreciation of colour. Shows the experiences of a young girl who goes to the castle of the gruesome gray monster to recover the colours he has stolen from the world.

results.title: Architecture
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, John Honey and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A vocational guidance film, shot on location in Tasmania, showing the training and work of an architect. Discusses the nature of the careers available.

results.title: Mammals
results.brief_description: Identifies through both common and uncommon examples, those chracteristics that set mammals apart from all other animals. Also shows that household pets may be relatives of large, wild animals. No other credits available. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Learning about reptiles
results.brief_description: Identifies biological characteristics, adaptations and eating habits of turtles, alligators, crocodiles, snakes, lizards and tortoises. Illustrates the versatility of these animals to adapt to environments ranging from harsh deserts to oceans. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Foundations of mathematics
results.creator_credit: Steve Campus and Steve Campus Productions
results.brief_description: Designed to show teachers working in the area of infant mathematics possible ways of using concrete equipment with an emphasis on formal pre-number work. Covers classifying and grouping; pattern; counting; equivalence; estimation; measurement; and shape. Suitable for lower primary and tertiary/teacher levels.

results.title: Exploring space: the sun and its energy. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Lee W. Gluckman and Coronet Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Uses simulation to show the space shuttle Enterprise placing a solar observatory into orbit. Describes the sun’s physical characteristics, explains its effect on earth and briefly the possibilities of solar energy.

results.title: The Moon and how it affects us. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Lee W. Gluckman and Coronet Films
